content.description: Start with one hand on each side of the steep V arete.  On the left side of the V there are two chalked crimps, with it being slightly harder to start on the higher one.  Get established on the right side of the V and climb up the headwall towards the horizontal crack feature.
content.location: From the front side parking area walk along the trail towards Laguna Prieta.  Before hitting the Lagoon, turn right and hike up a short ways to the V-Obsession boulder.  This is one level below the Theatre of the Absurd area.  If you hit Asylum crack you've gone too far towards the Lagoon.

content.description:
Where isn't the crux?  Sustained V8 climbing the separates nicely into two distinct boulder problems.  Begin way back in the cave on a sidepull sloping jug and make your way through slopey compression jugs using kneebars, bicycles, and toe hooks to get to a jug that is hard to match.  Bust out left to a crimp and a then a good sloper and get established on the lip.  After getting to the jug your can drop off or do a chossy highball finish that is about V2 (hence the PG13 grade). 

  Two stars for cool movement and holds.  The low ball traverse, some chossy rock and the dab potential detract from the overall obvious line.
content.protection: 2 pads (and a very thin one to cover a rock at your back when doing the transition between the two distinct sections of the climb)
content.location: This route is at the top of the Asylum.

content.description:
Cool movement on mostly good holds with a high intimidation factor. 

  Stand tall off the slab and stretch up to a juggy hueco. Match and work up on underclings and right facing holds that leave you feeling out of balance eventually gaining the right starting hold of the high problem with your left hand. Match then move left to a cool pinch and a big move up to a jug at the lip. The top out is pretty easy. 

  The first few moves are over a small flat landing zone in the lower area up until you make the first move out left to the good gaston. Then going into the undercling and moving up to the starting olds of the high start you are over the square edge of the platform that the high start begins on and a fall could be bad. Going to the undercling and getting your feet up is probably the most dangerous bit. Falling off the move to the start of the higher problem is relatively safe but intimidating.
content.protection: A pad down low, one up high and one draped over the lip. Two spotters.
content.location: Right side of the wall that Asylum Crack is on. Start low near the arete off of the slab.

content.description: Start on the big hueco (LH) and sloper (RH) and climb up the steep wall on a variety of interesting crimps.
content.location: It’s basically underneath Theatre of the Absurd. Approach from the frontside bathrooms, taking the trail toward the Asylum. Before the path goes behind the Asylum, take a right fork to the front of the Asylum. Walk over a pedestrian bridge and then another 50 ft or so to a left hand turnoff that deposits you at a picnic slab (no table or awning). From there look for a tunnel between two boulders and go through (toss pads over the top, they won’t fit without dragging hard in the dirt). This climbs the right side of the heavily chalked boulder. Eurydice (V9ish) starts on a beautiful crimp shelf to the left and traverses into the upper moves of Orpheus.

content.description: Start sitting with an obvious sharp flake.  Paste your feet and make a big move to a left crimp.  From here follow more crimps to a relatively easy top out.  While it may seem relatively uninspiring due to the extreme sit start it is actually kind of fun.
content.location: Starts just left of V-Obsession.  This group of boulders is ~50ft up the hill just before Asylum crack.

content.description: Start on the flaky crimp section, move up and toss out to the arete, top out.    Not the finest, but worth the 10 yard hike if you're working on the V1s on the back side of Nurse Ratchet.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter of course.
content.location: The Asylum, directly uphill from Nurse Ratchet.

content.description: Hidden in the Asylum underneath an overhanging bouler.   Start on the flake system and throw out right to a just then crawl over the arete an climb up the rest of the face
Powerful roof climbing leads to a rest. Get something back and do another boulder problem on sharp crimps.
content.location: Start on Theater of Absurd Monkeys, but go left all the way to steep crimpy arete.

content.description: Two hand start on left side pull and horizontal crimp. Continue upwards to the right. Don’t go left where holds are chossy.
Start on the largest crimp shelf left of Orpheus. Traverse into the upper crimps on Orpheus.

This great problem is kinda like an easier version of the mega-classic dragonfly.  Longer and just as steep, this lacks the difficult footholds and challenging topout of dragonfly, allowing the moderate grade.  This would be a classic if it wasn't so difficult not too hit your back, and take an unintentional rest on the boulder behind you half way up. 

  Start low to the ground on good holds at the lower level.  Lieback your way up, being careful not to dab on the boulder behind at the 10 foot mark.  A little above the crux is encountered on smaller holds, but with good feet.  Hang on and reach the huge jugs above allowing an easy topout.  It is easy to step off onto the upper boulder if things get too scary. 

  To descend, head left from the top of the problem, through an easy  but kinda tricky to find downclimb, and work your way back to the start.
content.protection: Nice to have several pads and at least two spotters to protect both the upper and lower levels.
content.location:
Follow the main Asylum trail.  It leads right by Asylum Crack the obvious left leaning crack, about 25 feet to the right of the trail. 

  There are several nice pictographs to look for in the area, if you like that sort of thing.

content.description: The Asylum is a tall formation separated from the main part of North Mountain by the lagoon "Laguna Prieta".  The boulder problems are located on the backside of the formation away from the road.  There are around 20 established problems here on four main boulders.  The V-Obsession boulder, Theater of the Absurd, Asylum Crack and Stanage on Holiday.
